description.plain:
Steven Universe is a Cartoon Network animated series created by Rebecca Sugar. The show revolves around Steven, a half-human-half-Gem boy, and his adventures with the Crystal Gems, humanoid aliens warriors who are sworn to protect the Earth from interstellar threats.



The show has been critically acclaimed and has a large fanbase. Steven Universe’s complex lore helps to distinguish it from “your standard “monster of the week” cartoon to something that’s actually telling an interesting, deep meta-story”. Steven Universe has been praised for tackling issues such as this that are usually deemed as ‘too adult’ for a children’s show. Steven inherited his Gem powers from his mother, the former leader of the Crystal Gems, who gave up her physical form to create him. The absence of Rose allows the show to tackle grief and processing the loss of a loved one.



Sexuality is explicitly addressed through romance between the female-presenting Gems, Ruby and Sapphire.



Gems are genderless because they are an alien species, although, they are female presenting by choice. James Whitbrook of Gizmodo acknowledged the show’s inversion of gender roles and the Magical Girl genre with Steven, a male protagonist:

Steven is portrayed as anything but traditionally masculine. He’s unafraid of showing emotion for his friends and family, he is equally comfortable in hanging out with women… as he is with other boys of his age or his father Greg. Steven embodies the same sort of femininity that all Magical Girl leads do, he just happens to be a boy — and one that’s not uncomfortable with showing that side of himself… Steven is never ostracized for that by any other character in the series, but instead embraced for his openness in embracing the feminine and masculine sides of himself equally.

The show has been critically acclaimed and has a large fanbase. Steven Universe’s complex lore helps to distinguish it from “your standard “monster of the week” cartoon to something that’s actually telling an interesting, deep meta-story”. Steven Universe has been praised for tackling issues such as this that are usually deemed as ‘too adult’ for a children’s show. Steven inherited his Gem powers from his mother, the former leader of the Crystal Gems, who gave up her physical form to create him. The absence of Rose allows the show to tackle grief and processing the loss of a loved one.



Sexuality is explicitly addressed through romance between the female-presenting Gems, Ruby and Sapphire.



Gems are genderless because they are an alien species, although, they are female presenting by choice. James Whitbrook of Gizmodo acknowledged the show’s inversion of gender roles and the Magical Girl genre with Steven, a male protagonist:

Steven is portrayed as anything but traditionally masculine. He’s unafraid of showing emotion for his friends and family, he is equally comfortable in hanging out with women… as he is with other boys of his age or his father Greg. album.full_title: Dove Self-Esteem Project by Steven Universe
album.name: Dove Self-Esteem Project

annotatable.link_title: Appearance-Related Teasing and Bullying by Steven Universe
annotatable.title: Appearance-Related Teasing and Bullying

songs.lyrics:
AMETHYST: People say words can't hurt but I know from experience that's not true
JASPER: You look so small. You look so weak.
DIRECTOR: Jasper, a little to the right.
JASPER: Oh. You look wrong.
AMETHYST: So I'm short. I stayed in the ground a little too long. Got a little smushed, (Jasper chuckles), but maybe I'm okay like this. And maybe she's blowing things out of proportion 'cause she's got her own issues to work out.
JASPER: What?
AMETHYST: Who knows but what I do know is I can always say, hey I don't appreciate that.
JASPER: Who cares what you think, runt?
Jasper rampages and tears apart the set in the background
AMETHYST: Just be you. It's up to them to realize they're being the bully.
Jasper stops, steps in from of camera beside Amethyst
JASPER: No one deserves to be made fun of because of how they look. If you catch yourself making harmful comments, maybe think about where that anger is coming from.
DIRECTOR: Great cut!
JASPER: How do you keep your cool like that? This is soo much pressure.
AMETHYST: Pressure made me who I am.
JASPER: Wow.

description.plain: “being human” means that Steven is human now since he was a monster (but hes still half gem). he’s happy to be human and he needs do go somewhere else to move on from that(being a monster). He needs something else. He needs to move on.

songs.lyrics:
Just a little time
Just a little something else instead
Just a little time
Just a little something up ahead
I'm dreaming of

Being...
Being...
Being...
Being human

Just a little time
Just a little something that I need
Just a little time
Just a little feeling gaining speed
I'm dreaming of

Going...
Going...
Going...
Going somewhere else
Being...
Being...
Being...
Being human
